ground_truth: Their attention is fixed on the plain below where thousands of orcs can be seen marching away from Mount Doom. Frodo and Sam move across a hellish dry landscape of twisted volcanic rock and steaming fissures. Forty miles away, Mount Doom rises out of the plain, its feet founded in ashen ruin, its huge cone rising to a great height, where its reeking head is swathed in cloud. Aragorn's force of 500 approaches the great Black Gates of Mordor and he positions his troops about half a mile from the gates. Frodo is slumped against a rock and tries to drink from his water bottle but finds it empty; he gratefully takes a small sip from Sam's bottle. There is a moment of eye contact between Frodo and Sam as they acknowledge what lies ahead, and Sam offers Frodo his hand and pulls him up. At the Black Gates, Aragorn musters his men. Frodo and Sam stagger across the tortured landscape, no longer wearing the orc armor. Frodo is walking half-bowed, often stumbling, as if his eyes no longer see the way before his feet. His right hand is pressed against his chest, supporting a heavy weight, while his left hand often rises as if to ward off some invisible blow. Sam watches him, concern etched across his face, as Frodo hears a malevolent voice in his head calling to him. Sam looks behind him in time to see a ray of red light stab through the gloom and begin to sweep over the barren landscape. Sam throws himself to the ground, and Frodo turns to the light, unable to stop himself, crumpling to the ground as the red light hits him like a searchlight. All is quiet as Gandalf is watchful, nodding at Aragorn. Aragorn, Gandalf, Legolas, Gimli, Eomer, Merry, and Pippin gallop towards the Black Gates, pulling up less than 50 yards from the towering gates. Frodo is slumped on the ground, unable to move, as Aragorn moves his horse forward. From behind the huge gates, the terrifying chanting and clanging of the armor of thousands can be heard. With the sound of tortured metal, the massive gates begin to open. Legolas, Merry, and Eomer look on in trepidation as the Eye of Sauron sweeps the plains around them, and Sam gets to his feet. The Black Gates of Mordor swing open and Sauron's army of 300,000 emerges. Aragorn, Gandalf, Legolas, Gimli, Eomer, Merry, and Pippin gallop back towards their small army as the orc masses slowly march toward them. Behind them, the Eye of Sauron is directed toward them. Frodo's eyes open with a start as Sam crawls toward him. Frodo and Sam stagger to their feet and move off as the massive orc army marches towards Aragorn's men, who are starting to waver as the orcs encircle them.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Their focus is fixed on the flatland below where multitudes of orcs can be seen marching away from Mount Doom. Frodo and Sam move across a hellish arid landscape of distorted volcanic stone and steaming crevices. Forty miles away, Mount Doom rises out of the flatland, its base founded in ashen ruin, its enormous cone rising to a great height, where its reeking head is swathed in cloud. Aragorn's contingent of 500 approaches the great Black Gates of Mordor and he positions his soldiers about half a mile from the gates. Frodo is slumped against a stone and tries to drink from his water bottle but finds it empty; he gratefully takes a small sip from Sam's bottle. There is a moment of eye contact between Frodo and Sam as they recognize what lies ahead, and Sam offers Frodo his hand and pulls him up. At the Black Gates, Aragorn musters his troops. Frodo and Sam stagger across the tortured landscape, no longer wearing the orc armor. Frodo is walking half-bowed, often stumbling, as if his eyes no longer see the way before his feet. His right hand is pressed against his chest, supporting a heavy burden, while his left hand often rises as if to fend off some invisible strike. Sam watches him, concern etched across his face, as Frodo hears a malevolent voice in his head calling to him. Sam looks behind him in time to see a beam of red light stab through the gloom and begin to sweep over the barren landscape. Sam throws himself to the ground, and Frodo turns to the light, unable to stop himself, crumpling to the ground as the red light hits him like a searchlight. All is quiet as Gandalf is watchful, nodding at Aragorn. Aragorn, Gandalf, Legolas, Gimli, Eomer, Merry, and Pippin gallop towards the Black Gates, pulling up less than 50 yards from the towering gates. Frodo is slumped on the ground, unable to move, as Aragorn moves his steed forward. From behind the enormous gates, the terrifying chanting and clanging of the armor of thousands can be heard. With the sound of tortured metal, the massive gates begin to open. Legolas, Merry, and Eomer look on in trepidation as the Eye of Sauron sweeps the flats around them, and Sam gets to his feet. The Black Gates of Mordor swing open and Sauron's horde of 300,000 emerges. Aragorn, Gandalf, Legolas, Gimli, Eomer, Merry, and Pippin gallop back towards their small army as the orc masses slowly march toward them. Behind them, the Eye of Sauron is directed toward them. Frodo's eyes open with a start as Sam crawls toward him. Frodo and Sam stagger to their feet and move off as the massive orc horde marches towards Aragorn's men, who are starting to waver as the orcs encircle them.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Their attention is fixed on the plain below where thousands of orcs are seen marching away from Mount Doom. The hellish dry landscape of twisted volcanic rock and steaming fissures is moved across by Frodo and Sam. Forty miles away, out of the plain rises Mount Doom, founded in ashen ruin at its feet, with its huge cone rising to a great height, where its reeking head is swathed in cloud. The great Black Gates of Mordor are approached by Aragorn's force of 500, and his troops are positioned by him about half a mile from the gates. Against a rock, Frodo is slumped, and a drink from his water bottle is tried by him but is found empty; a small sip from Sam's bottle is gratefully taken by him. There is a moment of eye contact between Frodo and Sam as what lies ahead is acknowledged by them, and Frodo is offered Sam's hand and is pulled up by him. At the Black Gates, the men are mustered by Aragorn. The tortured landscape is staggered across by Frodo and Sam, no longer wearing the orc armor. Half-bowed, Frodo is walking, often stumbling, as if the way before his feet is no longer seen by his eyes. Against his chest, his right hand is pressed, supporting a heavy weight, while his left hand often rises as if to ward off some invisible blow. Concern etched across his face is watched by Sam as a malevolent voice in Frodo's head is heard by him, calling to him. Behind him, Sam looks in time to see a ray of red light stab through the gloom and begin to sweep over the barren landscape. To the ground, Sam throws himself, and to the light, Frodo turns, unable to stop himself, crumpling to the ground as the red light hits him like a searchlight. All is quiet as Aragorn is nodded at by Gandalf, while he is watchful. Towards the Black Gates gallop Aragorn, Gandalf, Legolas, Gimli, Eomer, Merry, and Pippin, pulling up less than 50 yards from the towering gates. On the ground, Frodo is slumped, unable to move, as Aragorn moves his horse forward. From behind the huge gates, the terrifying chanting and clanging of the armor of thousands can be heard. With the sound of tortured metal, the massive gates begin to open. In trepidation, Legolas, Merry, and Eomer look on as the plains around them are swept by the Eye of Sauron, and Sam gets to his feet. The Black Gates of Mordor swing open, and Sauron's army of 300,000 emerges. Back towards their small army gallop Aragorn, Gandalf, Legolas, Gimli, Eomer, Merry, and Pippin as the orc masses slowly march toward them. Directed toward them is the Eye of Sauron behind them. With a start, Frodo's eyes open as Sam crawls toward him. To their feet stagger Frodo and Sam and move off as the massive orc army marches towards Aragorn's men, who start to waver as the orcs encircle them.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Their focus is on the plain below, where thousands of orcs march from Mount Doom. Frodo and Sam traverse a hellish landscape of twisted volcanic rock and steaming fissures. Mount Doom, 40 miles away, rises from the plain, its base in ashen ruin and its cone towering, shrouded in cloud. Aragorn's 500 troops approach the Black Gates of Mordor, positioning half a mile away. Frodo, slumped against a rock, finds his water bottle empty and gratefully sips from Sam's. They exchange a look, acknowledging the challenge ahead, and Sam helps Frodo up. At the Black Gates, Aragorn rallies his men. Frodo and Sam, no longer in orc armor, stagger across the tortured landscape. Frodo, half-bowed and stumbling, presses his right hand to his chest, supporting a heavy weight, while his left hand rises as if to ward off an invisible blow. Sam watches with concern as Frodo hears a malevolent voice. Sam sees a red light sweep the barren landscape and throws himself down. Frodo turns to the light, crumpling as it hits him. All is quiet as Gandalf nods at Aragorn. Aragorn, Gandalf, Legolas, Gimli, Eomer, Merry, and Pippin gallop to the Black Gates, stopping less than 50 yards away. Frodo lies motionless as Aragorn advances. Behind the gates, terrifying chanting and clanging armor are heard. The massive gates open with tortured metal sounds. Legolas, Merry, and Eomer watch in trepidation as the Eye of Sauron sweeps the plains, and Sam stands. The Black Gates open, and Sauron's 300,000-strong army emerges. Aragorn and his companions retreat to their small army as the orcs advance. The Eye of Sauron focuses on them. Frodo's eyes open as Sam crawls to him. They stagger to their feet and move as the orc army encircles Aragorn's men, who begin to waver.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Their focus is on the plain where thousands of orcs march from Mount Doom. Frodo and Sam traverse a hellish landscape of volcanic rock and steam. Mount Doom looms 40 miles away, its cone shrouded in clouds. Aragorn's 500 troops approach Mordor's Black Gates, positioning half a mile away. Frodo, slumped and thirsty, sips from Sam's bottle. They exchange a look, acknowledging the challenge ahead, and Sam helps Frodo up. At the gates, Aragorn rallies his men. Frodo and Sam, without orc armor, stagger across the terrain. Frodo stumbles, burdened, as Sam watches with concern. Frodo hears a voice, and Sam sees a red light sweeping the land. Sam drops to the ground, and Frodo collapses as the light hits him. Gandalf nods at Aragorn as they approach the gates with Legolas, Gimli, Eomer, Merry, and Pippin. Frodo lies motionless as Aragorn advances. Behind the gates, the sound of armor and chanting grows. The gates open with a metallic groan. Legolas, Merry, and Eomer watch as Sauron's army of 300,000 emerges. Aragorn and his companions retreat to their army as orcs advance. The Eye of Sauron focuses on them. Frodo awakens as Sam crawls to him. They rise and move as the orc army encircles Aragorn's men, who begin to falter.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Their unwavering attention is firmly fixed on the expansive plain below, where countless thousands of orcs can be seen steadily marching away from the ominous Mount Doom. Frodo and Sam make their way across a hellish, dry landscape, characterized by twisted volcanic rock formations and steaming fissures that emit an eerie heat. In the distance, forty miles away, the formidable Mount Doom rises majestically out of the plain, its base entrenched in ashen ruin. Its enormous cone ascends to a great height, where its reeking summit is enveloped in swirling clouds. Meanwhile, Aragorn's force of 500 brave warriors approaches the formidable Black Gates of Mordor, and he strategically positions his troops about half a mile from the imposing gates. Frodo, exhausted, is slumped against a rock and attempts to drink from his water bottle, only to find it empty; he gratefully accepts a small sip from Sam's bottle. There is a poignant moment of eye contact between Frodo and Sam as they silently acknowledge the daunting challenges that lie ahead. Sam offers Frodo his hand, helping him to his feet. At the Black Gates, Aragorn gathers and musters his men. Frodo and Sam stagger across the tortured landscape, having shed their orc armor. Frodo walks half-bowed, frequently stumbling, as if his eyes no longer perceive the path before his feet. His right hand is pressed firmly against his chest, supporting a heavy, burdensome weight, while his left hand often rises as if to fend off some invisible blow. Sam watches him closely, concern etched deeply across his face, as Frodo hears a malevolent voice echoing in his mind, calling to him. Sam glances behind him just in time to see a ray of red light pierce through the gloom and begin to sweep over the barren landscape. Sam throws himself to the ground, and Frodo, unable to resist, turns toward the light, crumpling to the ground as the red light strikes him like a searchlight. All is eerily quiet as Gandalf remains watchful, nodding at Aragorn. Aragorn, Gandalf, Legolas, Gimli, Eomer, Merry, and Pippin gallop toward the Black Gates, pulling up less than 50 yards from the towering gates. Frodo lies slumped on the ground, unable to move, as Aragorn advances his horse forward. From behind the massive gates, the terrifying chanting and clanging of the armor of thousands can be heard. With the sound of tortured metal, the enormous gates begin to open. Legolas, Merry, and Eomer look on with trepidation as the Eye of Sauron sweeps the plains around them, and Sam gets to his feet. The Black Gates of Mordor swing open, and Sauron's vast army of 300,000 emerges. Aragorn, Gandalf, Legolas, Gimli, Eomer, Merry, and Pippin gallop back toward their small army as the orc masses slowly march toward them. Behind them, the Eye of Sauron is ominously directed toward them. Frodo's eyes open with a start as Sam crawls toward him. Frodo and Sam stagger to their feet and move off as the massive orc army advances toward Aragorn's men, who are beginning to waver as the orcs encircle them.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Their unwavering attention is firmly and intensely fixed on the expansive and seemingly endless plain below, a vast expanse where countless thousands of orcs can be seen steadily and relentlessly marching away from the ominous and foreboding Mount Doom. Frodo and Sam make their arduous journey across a hellish, desolate landscape, characterized by twisted and contorted volcanic rock formations and steaming fissures that emit an eerie and unsettling heat. In the far-off distance, approximately forty miles away, the formidable and imposing Mount Doom rises majestically out of the plain, its base entrenched in an ashen ruin that stretches far and wide. Its enormous and towering cone ascends to a great and dizzying height, where its reeking and smoke-filled summit is enveloped in swirling clouds. Meanwhile, Aragorn's force of 500 brave and valiant warriors approaches the formidable and imposing Black Gates of Mordor, and he strategically positions his troops about half a mile away from the imposing gates. Frodo, utterly exhausted and weary, is slumped against a rock and attempts to drink from his water bottle, only to find it dishearteningly empty; he gratefully accepts a small, precious sip from Sam's bottle. There is a poignant moment of mutual understanding and eye contact between Frodo and Sam as they silently acknowledge the daunting and formidable challenges that lie ahead of them. Sam offers Frodo his hand, helping him to his feet with gentle care. At the Black Gates, Aragorn gathers and musters his men with great urgency. Frodo and Sam stagger across the tortured and unforgiving landscape, having shed their cumbersome orc armor. Frodo walks half-bowed, frequently stumbling, as if his weary eyes no longer perceive the treacherous path before his feet. His right hand is pressed firmly against his chest, supporting a heavy and burdensome weight, while his left hand often rises as if to fend off some invisible and malevolent blow. Sam watches him closely, concern etched deeply across his face, as Frodo hears a malevolent, echoing voice in his mind, calling to him with sinister intent. Sam glances behind him just in time to see a piercing ray of red light cut through the surrounding gloom and begin to sweep over the barren landscape. Sam throws himself to the ground, and Frodo, unable to resist its pull, turns toward the light, crumpling to the ground as the red light strikes him forcefully like a searchlight. All is eerily and unsettlingly quiet as Gandalf remains watchful, nodding at Aragorn. Aragorn, Gandalf, Legolas, Gimli, Eomer, Merry, and Pippin gallop toward the Black Gates, pulling up less than 50 yards from the towering and imposing gates. Frodo lies slumped and motionless on the ground, unable to move, as Aragorn advances his horse forward. From behind the massive gates, the terrifying chanting and clanging of the armor of thousands can be heard. With the sound of tortured and groaning metal, the enormous gates begin to open. Legolas, Merry, and Eomer look on with trepidation and apprehension as the Eye of Sauron sweeps the plains around them, and Sam gets to his feet. The Black Gates of Mordor swing open ominously, and Sauron's vast army of 300,000 emerges ominously. Aragorn, Gandalf, Legolas, Gimli, Eomer, Merry, and Pippin gallop back toward their small, beleaguered army as the orc masses slowly and menacingly march toward them. Behind them, the Eye of Sauron is ominously and threateningly directed toward them. Frodo's eyes open with a start as Sam crawls toward him with urgency. Frodo and Sam stagger to their feet and move off as the massive orc army advances toward Aragorn's men, who are beginning to waver as the orcs encircle them.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Their attention is intensely focused on the plain below, where they can see thousands of orcs marching away from the ominous Mount Doom. Frodo and Sam navigate the hellish, dry landscape, carefully stepping over twisted volcanic rock and cautiously avoiding steaming fissures. In the distance, forty miles away, Mount Doom looms, its base entrenched in ashen ruin, and its massive cone ascends to a great height, its foul summit enveloped in swirling clouds. Meanwhile, Aragorn leads his force of 500 men, steadily approaching the formidable Black Gates of Mordor, and strategically positions his troops about half a mile from the gates. Frodo, exhausted, slumps against a rock and attempts to drink from his water bottle, only to discover it is empty; he gratefully accepts a small sip from Sam's bottle. They share a moment of eye contact, silently acknowledging the daunting task ahead, and Sam extends his hand to Frodo, helping him to his feet. At the Black Gates, Aragorn rallies his men, preparing them for the impending confrontation. Frodo and Sam, now without their orc armor, stagger across the tortured landscape. Frodo walks with a half-bowed posture, frequently stumbling as if his eyes can no longer perceive the path before him. His right hand is pressed firmly against his chest, as if supporting a heavy burden, while his left hand occasionally rises, as if to fend off an unseen threat. Sam watches him closely, concern etched across his face, as Frodo hears a sinister voice echoing in his mind. Sam glances behind him just in time to see a ray of red light pierce through the gloom, sweeping over the barren landscape. Instinctively, Sam throws himself to the ground, while Frodo, unable to resist, turns toward the light and collapses as the red beam strikes him like a searchlight. In the ensuing silence, Gandalf remains vigilant, nodding at Aragorn. Aragorn, along with Gandalf, Legolas, Gimli, Eomer, Merry, and Pippin, gallops toward the Black Gates, halting less than 50 yards from the towering gates. Frodo lies slumped on the ground, immobilized, as Aragorn advances his horse. From behind the immense gates, the terrifying sound of chanting and the clanging of thousands of armored soldiers can be heard. With a grating sound of tortured metal, the massive gates begin to open. Legolas, Merry, and Eomer watch with trepidation as the Eye of Sauron sweeps the plains around them, and Sam rises to his feet. The Black Gates of Mordor swing open, revealing Sauron's army of 300,000. Aragorn, Gandalf, Legolas, Gimli, Eomer, Merry, and Pippin gallop back toward their small army as the orc masses slowly advance toward them. Behind them, the Eye of Sauron is fixed upon them. Frodo's eyes snap open as Sam crawls toward him. Together, Frodo and Sam struggle to their feet and move away as the massive orc army marches toward Aragorn's men, who begin to falter as the orcs encircle them.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Their attention is fixed on the plain below, where thousands of orcs march away from Mount Doom. Frodo and Sam traverse a hellish landscape of volcanic rock and steaming fissures, with Mount Doom looming forty miles away, its peak shrouded in clouds. Meanwhile, Aragorn's force of 500 approaches the Black Gates of Mordor, positioning themselves half a mile from the gates. Frodo, slumped against a rock, finds his water bottle empty and gratefully accepts a sip from Sam's. They share a moment of understanding before Sam helps Frodo to his feet. At the Black Gates, Aragorn organizes his men. Frodo and Sam, no longer in orc armor, stagger across the tortured landscape, with Frodo stumbling under an unseen burden and Sam watching him with concern. Frodo hears a malevolent voice, and as a red light sweeps the landscape, Sam throws himself to the ground while Frodo crumples under its force. All is quiet as Gandalf nods at Aragorn, who, along with Gandalf, Legolas, Gimli, Eomer, Merry, and Pippin, gallops towards the Black Gates, stopping just short of them. The massive gates open with a sound of tortured metal, revealing Sauron's army of 300,000. As the Eye of Sauron sweeps the plains, Aragorn and his companions retreat to their small army, now encircled by the orc masses. Frodo and Sam, regaining their footing, move forward as the orc army advances on Aragorn's men, who begin to waver under the encroaching threat.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Their attention is fixed on the plain below where thousands of orcs, creatures bred for war by the dark lord Sauron, can be seen marching away from Mount Doom. This mountain, known as Orodruin in the Elvish language, is where the One Ring was forged in its fiery depths. Frodo and Sam move across a hellish dry landscape of twisted volcanic rock and steaming fissures, remnants of frequent eruptions and fiery turmoil. Forty miles away, Mount Doom rises out of the plain, its feet founded in ashen ruin, its huge cone rising to a great height, where its reeking head is swathed in cloud, signifying its active and volatile nature. Aragorn's force of 500, a coalition of humans and allies from across Middle-earth, approaches the great Black Gates of Mordor, formidable fortifications built by Sauron to keep intruders at bay, and he positions his troops about half a mile from the gates. Frodo is slumped against a rock and tries to drink from his water bottle but finds it empty; he gratefully takes a small sip from Sam's bottle, an act of camaraderie that underscores their deep bond. There is a moment of eye contact between Frodo and Sam as they acknowledge what lies ahead, the perils of their quest to destroy the Ring, and Sam offers Frodo his hand and pulls him up. At the Black Gates, Aragorn musters his men, preparing them for what may be their final stand. Frodo and Sam stagger across the tortured landscape, no longer wearing the orc armor that once served as their disguise. Frodo is walking half-bowed, often stumbling, as if his eyes no longer see the way before his feet, a sign of the heavy burden of the One Ring he carries, which corrupts all who bear it. His right hand is pressed against his chest, supporting a heavy weight, while his left hand often rises as if to ward off some invisible blow, likely a manifestation of the Ring's malevolent influence. Sam watches him, concern etched across his face, as Frodo hears a malevolent voice in his head calling to him, the voice of Sauron himself. Sam looks behind him in time to see a ray of red light, the Eye of Sauron, stab through the gloom and begin to sweep over the barren landscape. Sam throws himself to the ground, and Frodo turns to the light, unable to stop himself, crumpling to the ground as the red light hits him like a searchlight, paralyzing him with fear. All is quiet as Gandalf, the wise wizard known as Mithrandir to the Elves, is watchful, nodding at Aragorn. Aragorn, Gandalf, Legolas, a skilled Elven archer, Gimli, a stalwart Dwarf warrior, Eomer, the valiant horse lord of Rohan, Merry, and Pippin gallop towards the Black Gates, pulling up less than 50 yards from the towering gates. Frodo is slumped on the ground, unable to move, as Aragorn moves his horse forward. From behind the huge gates, the terrifying chanting and clanging of the armor of thousands, indicative of the vast orc armies, can be heard. With the sound of tortured metal, the massive gates begin to open. Legolas, Merry, and Eomer look on in trepidation as the Eye of Sauron sweeps the plains around them, an ever-watchful presence. Sam gets to his feet. The Black Gates of Mordor swing open, and Sauron's army of 300,000 emerges, an overwhelming force. Aragorn, Gandalf, Legolas, Gimli, Eomer, Merry, and Pippin gallop back towards their small army, realizing the odds they face, as the orc masses slowly march toward them. Behind them, the Eye of Sauron is directed toward them, a constant reminder of the dark power they oppose. Frodo's eyes open with a start as Sam crawls toward him, determined to keep his friend safe. Frodo and Sam stagger to their feet and move off as the massive orc army marches towards Aragorn's men, who are starting to waver as the orcs encircle them, their courage tested to the limit.

Frodo and Sam move across a hellish dry landscape of twisted volcanic rock and steaming fissures. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. Sam looks behind him in time to see a ray of red light stab through the gloom and begin to sweep over the barren landscape. Sam throws himself to the ground and Frodo turns to the light unable to stop himself crumpling to the ground as the red light hits him like a searchlight. All is quiet as Gandalf is watchful nodding at Aragorn. Aragorn Gandalf Legolas Gimli Eomer Merry and Pippin gallop towards the Black Gates pulling up less than 50 yards from the towering gates. The Black Gates of Mordor swing open and Sauron's army of 300000 emerges. Aragorn Gandalf Legolas Gimli Eomer Merry and Pippin gallop back towards their small army as the orc masses slowly march toward them. Behind them the Eye of Sauron is directed toward them. Frodo's eyes open with a start as Sam crawls toward him. Frodo and Sam stagger to their feet and move off as the massive orc army marches towards Aragorn's men who are starting to waver as the orcs encircle them.

Frodo is slumped against a rock and tries to drink from his water bottle but finds it empty. he gratefully takes a small sip from Sam's bottle. There is a moment of eye contact between Frodo and Sam as they acknowledge what lies ahead and Sam offers Frodo his hand and pulls him up. At the Black Gates Aragorn musters his men. Frodo and Sam stagger across the tortured landscape no longer wearing the orc armor. Frodo is walking halfbowed often stumbling as if his eyes no longer see the way before his feet. His right hand is pressed against his chest supporting a heavy weight while his left hand often rises as if to ward off some invisible blow. Sam watches him concern etched across his face as Frodo hears a malevolent voice in his head calling to him. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. Sam looks behind him in time to see a ray of red light stab through the gloom and begin to sweep over the barren landscape. Sam throws himself to the ground and Frodo turns to the light unable to stop himself crumpling to the ground as the red light hits him like a searchlight. All is quiet as Gandalf is watchful nodding at Aragorn. Aragorn Gandalf Legolas Gimli Eomer Merry and Pippin gallop towards the Black Gates pulling up less than 50 yards from the towering gates. Frodo is slumped on the ground unable to move as Aragorn moves his horse forward. From behind the huge gates the terrifying chanting and clanging of the armor of thousands can be heard. With the sound of tortured metal the massive gates begin to open. Legolas Merry and Eomer look on in trepidation as the Eye of Sauron sweeps the plains around them and Sam gets to his feet. The Black Gates of Mordor swing open and Sauron's army of 300000 emerges. Aragorn Gandalf Legolas Gimli Eomer Merry and Pippin gallop back towards their small army as the orc masses slowly march toward them. Behind them the Eye of Sauron is directed toward them. Frodo's eyes open with a start as Sam crawls toward him. Frodo and Sam stagger to their feet and move off as the massive orc army marches towards Aragorn's men who are starting to waver as the orcs encircle them.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Their attention is fixed on the plain below where thousands of orcs can be seen marching away from Mount Doom. Frodo and Sam move across a hellish dry landscape of twisted volcanic rock and steaming fissures. Forty miles away Mount Doom rises out of the plain. its feet founded in ashen ruin its huge cone rising to a great height where its reeking head is swathed in cloud. Aragorn's force of 500 approaches the great Black Gates of Mordor and he positions his troops about half a mile from the gates. Frodo is slumped against a rock and tries to drink from his water bottle but finds it empty. he gratefully takes a small sip from Sam's bottle. Legolas Merry and Eomer look on in trepidation as the Eye of Sauron sweeps the plains around them and Sam gets to his feet. The Black Gates of Mordor swing open and Sauron's army of 300000 emerges. Aragorn Gandalf Legolas Gimli Eomer Merry and Pippin gallop back towards their small army as the orc masses slowly march toward them. Behind them the Eye of Sauron is directed toward them. Frodo's eyes open with a start as Sam crawls toward him. Frodo and Sam stagger to their feet and move off as the massive orc army marches towards Aragorn's men who are starting to waver as the orcs encircle them.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: Their attention is fixed on the plain below where thousands of orcs can be seen marching away from Mount Doom. Frodo and Sam move across a hellish dry landscape of twisted volcanic rock and steaming fissures. Forty miles away Mount Doom rises out of the plain. Behind them the Eye of Sauron is directed toward them. Frodo's eyes open with a start as Sam crawls toward him. Frodo and Sam stagger to their feet and move off as the massive orc army marches towards Aragorn's men who are starting to waver as the orcs encircle them.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Their fascination is anchored on the ocean above where hundreds of penguins can be spotted flying toward Mount Delight. Percy and Joe slide across a heavenly wet meadow of tangled forest vines and bubbling geysers. Sixty miles nearby, Mount Delight towers above the ocean, its base immersed in snowy splendor, its huge dome soaring to a grand summit, where its fragrant peak is wrapped in mist. Lancelot's squad of 300 nears the grand White Gates of Alabaster and he arranges his scouts about a mile from the gates. Percy is sprawled against a tree and attempts to sip from his juice box but finds it full; he reluctantly takes a large gulp from Joe's flask. There is a moment of glances between Percy and Joe as they acknowledge what rests ahead, and Joe hands Percy his knee and nudges him down. At the White Gates, Lancelot gathers his scouts. Percy and Joe drift across the serene meadow, no longer donning the penguin outfits. Percy is gliding fully upright, occasionally bounding, as if his ears no longer hear the tune above his head. His left foot is pressed against his arm, supporting a feathery weight, while his right foot often lowers as if to embrace some invisible touch. Joe observes him, delight sketched across his forehead, as Percy feels a benevolent song in his mind humming to him. Joe looks ahead of him in time to catch a burst of blue shadow dance through the brightness and start to leap over the lush meadow. Joe leaps into the air, and Percy turns from the shadow, unable to contain himself, rising to the sky as the blue shadow wraps him like a spotlight. Everything hums as Merlin is restful, chuckling at Lancelot. Lancelot, Merlin, Robin, Fred, Arthur, Bob, and Bill sail toward the White Gates, pausing more than 100 meters from the looming gates. Percy is lifted into the air, free to fly, as Lancelot pushes his ship onward. From beyond the small gates, the soothing humming and chimes of the shields of hundreds rain down. With the melody of delighted strings, the tiny gates shut tight. Robin, Bob, and Arthur gaze on in glee as the Sound of Harmony dances the meadows nearby them, and Joe leaps to the sky. The White Gates of Alabaster clasp shut and Harmony's choir of 30,000 retreats. Lancelot, Merlin, Robin, Fred, Arthur, Bob, and Bill glide away from their great scouts as the penguin flocks swiftly fly from them. Above them, the Sound of Harmony sings away from them. Percy's ears shut with a pause as Joe bounces away from him. Percy and Joe leap to the sky and drift off as the tiny penguin choir skips from Lancelot's scouts, who are starting to cheer as the penguins hug them.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Frodo and Sam traverse a hellish landscape of volcanic rock headed towards Mount Doom, while Aragorn's force of 500 approaches the Black Gates of Mordor. Frodo, struggling with the Ring's burden, shares a moment with Sam as they brace for the final challenge. At the Black Gates, Aragorn and his companions—Gandalf, Legolas, Gimli, Eomer, Merry, and Pippin—prepare for battle. As Frodo weakens under the Ring’s influence, the Eye of Sauron sweeps the plain, exposing him to its malevolent gaze. The Black Gates open, releasing Sauron's army of 300,000. Aragorn's forces face the looming orc horde while Sam aids a faint Frodo. As Sauron's army encircles Aragorn's men, Frodo and Sam press on toward their daunting mission.
